intro: Rhynchospora teres, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to reddish flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in moist soils. Rhynchospora teres plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
